body: > Currently in [the authentication section](https://w3c.github.io/webauthn/#authn-ceremony-update-credential-record) it's allowed to change but only via the `credProps` extension which will no longer have it.  Hm. That step was never intended to imply that it is the _only_ allowed way to change a credential nickname. This suggests even more strongly to me that we should just delete `credential record/authenticatorDisplayName` altogether, and if anything just hint vaguely at the idea of allowing users to set a credential nickname.

I think that was more of an oversight as [the registration ceremony](https://w3c.github.io/webauthn/#reg-ceremony-store-credential-record) only mentions `credProps` as a possible _additional_ mechanism to set `authenticatorDisplayName`. The authentication section should have been written similarly. Regardless, I don't care enough about this; so if people want it removed, then so be it.
